monogr.title: Honest counsaile : A merrie fitte of a poeticall furie: good to read, better to follow
monogr.author: Breton, Nicholas

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p: ALl good Fathers that loue their Children, and all good Children that would be loued of their Fathers, reade and follow, if you can, and will, this Honest Counsaile; fetcht out of an odde Furie: no matter for the Rime, so the Reason serue turne: hee meant well that wrote it; and you may take it well that read it: It is a Kalender of good Notes; and hee that studies it well, may happe be as wise as a Walnut: Yet, as there is somewhat to laugh at, so there is somewhat to looke at; which well perused, may yeelde profite: Such as it is, I commende it to your witte, and leysure, to make vse of, as you haue Reason: How soeuer it like your humour, shew no Imperfection; but if you finde it to your minde, much good do it you: if not, let it not trouble you: So wishing you to do as you list, I rest as I finde cause.
